questions.question: What is the principle that states 'the number of ways a (finite) set can be partitioned into (non-empty) subsets'?
In graph theory, what is the term for a walk in which no graph edges are repeated?
What is the number of combinations of 'n' items taken 'r' at a time, denoted by C(n, r) or 'n choose r'?
What does the 'Exclusive OR' (XOR) operation do in Boolean Algebra?
options: Outputs true if both inputs are the same
Outputs true if both inputs are different
Outputs false if both inputs are the same
Outputs false if both inputs are different
questions.correct_answer: Outputs true if both inputs are different

questions.question: Which of the following best describes the function of the 'Big O notation' in Computer Science?
options: It indicates the maximum time complexity of an algorithm
It indicates the minimum time complexity of an algorithm
It provides the exact time complexity of an algorithm
It provides the average time complexity of an algorithm
questions.correct_answer: It indicates the maximum time complexity of an algorithm
